intro: Zappania dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous zappania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive branching pattern, with stems that split into two equal parts, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in whorls along the stem. These flowers are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Zappania dichotoma is native to tropical regions and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
